name: Chad's Slow Cooker Taco Soup
author: AccountKiller
summary: This easy soup is hearty, yet extremely tasty. This is really a form of chili, but uses some ingredients not found in regular chili.  Sure to be a hit, you can adjust the spice as needed by using varying levels of jalapenos and RO*TEL® varieties. Top with shredded sharp Cheddar cheese and/or sour cream. Serve with tortilla chips. Leftovers can be frozen and enjoyed later.
ingredients: 1 (15.25 ounce) can whole kernel corn with red and green bell peppers (such as Mexicorn®), drained and rinsed
1 (14.5 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
1 (14 ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained
1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL®), undrained
1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle dark beer
directions: Brown the ground beef completely in a large skillet over medium heat; drain
Transfer the beef to a slow cooker
Brown the sausage completely in a large skillet over medium heat; drain
Transfer the beef to a slow cooker

Add the crushed tomatoes, corn, black beans, kidney beans, ranch dressing mix,   mix, onion, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, chili sauce, jalapeno peppers, beer, and black pepper to the slow cooker
Set slow cooker to Low and cook 8 to 10 hours, or, if you prefer, on High for 4 to 6 hours
